abstract: A PBS documentary works hard to portray Kenneth D. Lewis, BofA’s chief, as the victim of a bullying government and an entitled Wall Street bonus culture, The New York Times’s Gina Bellafante writes.
snippet: A PBS documentary works hard to portray Kenneth D. Lewis, BofA’s chief, as the victim of a bullying government and an entitled Wall Street bonus culture, The New York Times’s Gina Bellafante writes.
lead_paragraph: Central to the “Frontline” franchise is the notion that the little guy is always right and deserving of our sympathies, apparently even if his personal fortune might exceed many city council budgets by a factor of 100, The New York Times’s Gina Bellafante writes.

headline.main: Looking for the Little Guy Among Wall Street Giants
